bug.short_desc: Defect: Inline app Window - drag issue

long_desc.thetext:
Reported by Chris Banford:
Having the Window be the farthest element to the right and/or bottom of a page, moving the Browser's scroll bars all the way to the right/bottom and then trying to drag the qx window by its title bar. The qx Window is 'freezing'.
In FF 2/3, Opera 9.5, Safari 3.1 (win xp) The Window moves 1-2 pixels and then blocks. Each attempt at moving the window just gives the 1-2 pixel movement amount.
IE 6/7 Works fine. IE handles this better than the above browsers (go figure!).
Here are the steps to reproduce:
1. Create and show a normal qx Window in a qx.application.Inline app. 2. Set the html document to a fixed width (say, of 300px or so), so the html content doesn't expand to fill the browser's view. See attached Win drag 1.jpg 3. Make the browser window fairly small, and drag the qx Window mostly out of view to the right (causes the browser's scroll bar to grow). See attached Win drag 2.jpg 4. Use the Browser scroll bar to move as far to the right as possible. The qx Window is now the 'right-most' element on the html page. See attached Win drag 3.jpg 5. Now try and drag the qx Window anywhere by its Title bar.
If one sets the Window to use a 'move-frame' then this isn't an issue, as only the move-frame is dragged and the actual Window element is left at its original position (ie the Browser's scroll bars aren't updated). win.setUseMoveFrame( true );
What I was thinking would solve the issue would be to place a small temp element, at the Window's bottom/right co-ordinates, for the duration of the drag operation, and when the Window drag stops remove it (hide it, etc). This would keep the scroll bars from trying to update and freezing the user interaction.

Changed the affected code, now the implementation depends only on IDesktop.
Fixed in trunk (r18738).
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
